Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek black-figured pottery open vase, perhaps a bowl. Inside streakily glazed with added red band lined in white. Exterior: above, pendent lotus and bud frieze; red for lotus flower; below, lion (head and shoulders preserved) to left; rosette fill in front; red for mane.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ.(?)
Curator's comments: This sherd is labelled in pencil Φ (however this and another unreadable character are obscured and unclear), designating this as coming from a context excavated by Petrie within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, during Gardner’s excavations at Naukratis in 1885-1886.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1119)
